secondaryIdInfos.domain: Part the Cloud-Gates Partnership Grant Program

identificationModule.briefTitle: Veri-T: A Trial of Verdiperstat in Patients With svPPA Due to TDP-43 Pathology
identificationModule.officialTitle: Phase 1, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics, Pharmacodynamics and Preliminary Efficacy Study of Oral Verdiperstat (BHV-3241) in Patients With Semantic Variant Primary Progressive Aphasia (svPPA) Due to TDP-43 Pathology

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of the study is to test the safety and tolerability of twice daily Verdiperstat in patients with semantic variant primary progressive aphasia (svPPA) due to frontotemporal lobar degeneration with TDP-43 pathology (FTLD-TDP). Three-fourths of the participants will receive Verdiperstat and one-fourth will receive Placebo during the 24-week treatment duration.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
This is a Phase 1, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled study of the safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics, pharmacodynamics, and preliminary efficacy of Verdiperstat in patients with semantic variant primary progressive aphasia (svPPA) due to frontotemporal lobar degeneration with TDP-43 pathology (FTLD-TDP). Approximately 64 subjects will be randomized 3:1 to active drug or placebo. Study drug will be administered orally bid (two Verdiperstat tablets bid or two placebo tablets bid (for a total daily dose of 600mg daily, following a one-week titration period of 1 tablet daily).

The study will test the effects of Verdiperstat on cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) proteins, brain magnetic resonance imaging (MRI), and cognitive (thinking, memory and language) tests in subjects with svPPA due to FTLD-TDP. This study uses placebo which looks like the experimental drug but does not have any active drug in it.

maskingInfo.maskingDescription: Double-blind study. Only investigational pharmacist will be unblinded

armGroups.label: Verdiperstat
armGroups.description: Verdiperstat 2 tablets twice daily (600mg total daily) by mouth for 24 weeks.

armGroups.label: Placebo
armGroups.description: Placebo 2 tablets twice daily by mouth for 24 weeks.

primaryOutcomes.description: Assess adverse events during 6 months administration of Verdiperstat or Placebo

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Changes in Pharmacokinetic properties of Verdiperstat in Cerebrospinal Fluid (CSF)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Measure steady-state cerebrospinal fluid concentrations of Verdiperstat and its metabolites

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Changes in Pharmacokinetic properties of Verdiperstat in Plasma
secondaryOutcomes.description: Measure steady-state plasma concentrations of Verdiperstat and its metabolites

otherOutcomes.measure: Changes in Pharmacodynamic (PD) properties of Verdiperstat in Plasma
Changes in Pharmacodynamic properties of CSF biomarkers of neurofilament light chain protein
otherOutcomes.description: Measure CSF concentrations of neurofilament light chain protein (NfL) pg/ml

otherOutcomes.measure: Change in brain volume on brain MRI
otherOutcomes.description: Measure of global and regional volumes of interest (such as whole brain and temporal lobes)

otherOutcomes.measure: Change in structural and functional connectivity on brain MRI
otherOutcomes.description: Connectivity between brain regions measured using diffusion tensor MRI and resting state functional MRI

otherOutcomes.measure: Change in Clinical Dementia Rating Scale (CDR-SB)
otherOutcomes.description: Measure change in dementia status using the Clinical Dementia Rating (CDR) Demential Staging Instrument plus National Alzheimer's Coordinating Center (NACC) Behavior and Language Domains (CDR plus NACC FTLD)
Measure change in executive function using the National Institutes of Health (NIH) Executive Abilities Assessment (NIH EXAMINER)
Measure change in language function using the Boston Naming Test
Measure semantic fluency using the Delis-Kaplan Executive Function System (D-KEFS)
Measure language function abilities using a digitalized analysis of prompted monolog and a picture description task on a mobile application
Measure using the Neuropsychiatric Inventory (NPI) questionnaire

locations.facility: Houston Methodist Hospital - Nantz National Alzheimer Center
